content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Extraction System at position (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– A burner inserter (extraction system unit) positioned at (–3.5, 27.5) with its drop point at (–3.5, 28.5)
Use-case: Extracts items from a deposit for onward transport.

### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5–3.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– A cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– A new factory burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT
– An existing factory burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
– An assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5)
Use-case: Processes copper plates into copper cables and feeds the production line.

### Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot
– A dedicated transport belt segment positioned at (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the chest
– A depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP
Use-case: Provides an intermediate connection point to route items from the extraction system into the factory network.

### Electricity Generator at position (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– A generator (steam engine) at (–0.5, 24.5)
– A boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)
– An offshore pump at (–7.5, 25.5)
Use-case: Supplies power to the facility (despite current warnings regarding power connections and fluid input).

ERROR TIPS

• Transport Belt Connection Errors
  – When connecting transport belts, ensure the target entity is not a steam engine. Always add an inserter to serve as the input for the steam engine so that connections are accepted.

• Placement Distance Issues
  – Verify that the agent is within the allowed placement range before attempting to place an entity. If the target position is too far, move closer to meet the distance requirement.

• Missing Inventory Items
  – Before placing an item (such as a wooden chest), confirm that it is present in the player's inventory to avoid placement failures due to missing items.

• Undefined Variable Errors
  – Ensure that all variables are correctly defined and referenced. Validate variable names to prevent NameError issues when accessing properties of intended target entities.
